column4: Using Ubuntu 10.10 on an older computer and wireless is a big problem with it. I have tried everything, I updated the system with Update Manager, then went to the install blah blah drivers and tried the B43 Wireless drive (which worked the first time, a long time ago) but now I always get a "SystemError: installArchives() failed" error right after I click activate on the B43 Wireless drive. Can anyone please help me?
Are  you connected so that you can sow us the output of lspci ?  If so, do lspci | pastebinit
You already said that.
I got no response :\
ok but it will take one sec
http://pastebin.com/qHjC7Fcu
Ok, well, those BCM4312-LP-PHY wifi devices are a problem.  This is a laptop?
yes ut is
If it were me, I'd take the thing out and get another one.
I do but my sisters use the internet all the time, so there is absolutely no way to fix it?
What is the make and model of the laptop?
Dell and honestly I don't really know how old etc it is
Inspiron 1525 also
http://forums.linuxmint.com/viewtopic.php?f=90&t=68219   <--This looks interesting.
let me try that right quick

I did what the guy in the thread did, rebooted, went to install addition drives (STA Wireless was installed) changed it to B43 Wireless, then rebooted and now under wireless connections is says "Wireless is disabled", I don't ever remember disabling it :\ How can I re-enable it now?
It's a switch or keystoke combination on the laptop.  You just have to look for it.
you should see it on there someplace...
so this means it will work, correct? Or is there still a chance it's screwed up?
in the setup Wireless is enabled, whats the deal with that?
iwconfig | pastebinit
http://pastebin.com/bnEReuX1
